fields.name: service_date
fields.description: Service date. References GTFS indirectly via calendars.txt and calendar_dates.txt

fields.name: trip_id_performed
fields.title: ID referencing trips_performed.trip_id_performed
fields.description: Identifies the trip performed

fields.name: trip_stop_sequence
fields.description:
The actual order of stops visited within a performed trip. The values must start at 1 and must be consecutive along the trip.
Example: A bus departs the first stop and detours around the second and third scheduled stops, visiting one unscheduled stop and resuming regular service at the 4th scheduled stop. The `scheduled_stop_sequence` is [1, null, 4], and the `trip_stop_sequence` is [1, 2, 3].

fields.name: scheduled_stop_sequence
fields.title: positive integer referencing GTFS stop_times.stop_sequence
fields.description: Scheduled order of stops for a particular trip. The values must increase along the trip but do not need to be consecutive. References GTFS

fields.name: pattern_id
fields.title: unique identifier for the route-pattern
fields.description: Identifies the unique stop-path for a trip, may be distinct from GTFS shapes.shape_id

fields.name: vehicle_id
fields.title: ID referencing vehicles.vehicle_id
fields.description: Identifies the vehicle.

fields.name: dwell
fields.description: Indicates the amount of time a vehicle spent stopped at a stop in seconds.

fields.name: stop_id
fields.title: ID referencing GTFS stops.stop_id
fields.description: Identifies the stop. References GTFS

fields.name: timepoint
fields.description: Indicates if the stop should be used for evaluating schedule adherence, on-time performance, and other KPIs. This could be populated to match the GTFS “timepoint” field.

fields.name: schedule_arrival_time
fields.description: Scheduled timestamp at which the vehicle arrives at a stop. References GTFS

fields.name: schedule_departure_time
fields.description: Scheduled timestamp at which the vehicle departs from a stop. References GTFS

fields.name: actual_arrival_time
fields.description: Timestamp at which the vehicle arrives at a stop.

fields.name: actual_departure_time
fields.description: Timestamp at which the vehicle departs from a stop.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: Observed distance in meters from the previous stop traveled by the vehicle.

fields.name: boarding_1
fields.description: Number of riders who entered through the vehicle's front doors (in vehicles with doors opening on only one side, or when passengers primarily board through the front, as is typical with buses) or the vehicle's right doors (in vehicles with doors on both sides, or when passengers board through all doors, as is typical with trains).

fields.name: alighting_1
fields.description: Number of riders who exited through the vehicle's front doors (in vehicles with doors opening on only one side, or when passengers primarily board through the front, as is typical with buses) or the vehicle's right doors (in vehicles with doors on both sides, or when passengers board through all doors, as is typical with trains).

fields.name: boarding_2
fields.description: Number of riders who entered through other doors, such as a bus's rear door when boarding_1 captures the front door, or a train's left doors when boarding_1 captures right doors.

fields.name: alighting_2
fields.description: Number of riders who exited through other doors, such as a bus's rear door when alighting_1 captures the front door, or a train's left doors when alighting_1 captures right doors.

fields.name: departure_load
fields.description: Number of riders on the vehicle when departing the stop.

fields.name: door_open
fields.description: Timestamp at which the doors opened.

fields.name: door_close
fields.description: Timestamp at which the doors closed.

fields.name: door_status
fields.description: Indicates actions of the doors during the stop visit.

enum: Front door opened and back doors remain closed
Back doors opened and front door remained closed

fields.name: ramp_deployed_time
fields.description: Duration of time a ramp is deployed, in seconds.

fields.name: ramp_failure
fields.description: Indicates if the ramp deployment failed at a stop.

fields.name: kneel_deployed_time
fields.description: Duration of time a kneel is deployed in seconds.

fields.name: lift_deployed_time
fields.description: Duration of time in seconds of time a lift is deployed.

fields.name: bike_rack_deployed
fields.description: Indicates if the bike rack was deployed at a stop.

fields.name: bike_load
fields.description: Number of bikes on the vehicle when departing the stop.

fields.name: revenue
fields.description: Amount of revenue collected at the stop.

fields.name: number_of_transactions
fields.description: Number of fare transactions that occurred at a stop.

fields.name: schedule_relationship
fields.description: Indicates the status of stop’s service on the trip.(Note: schedule_arrival_time and schedule_departure_time may differ from GTFS in the case of a schedule modification). References GTFS-realtime TripUpdate

name: stop_visits.schema.json
description: Summarized boarding, alighting, arrival, departure, and other events (kneel engaged, ramp deployed, etc.) by trip and stop for each service date.
